image.altText: Two tanks with Israeli flags on them.

props.synopsis: The Israeli Defense Forces say Israeli soldiers are now on the ground inside Rafah, Gaza's southern-most city. Look back on our coverage here.

title.children: Israel says it has taken control of Palestinian side of Rafah crossing

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold at 4.35 per cent, but vows to remain vigilant and warns it "is not ruling anything in or out".

title.children: 'Too soon to declare victory' as RBA governor Bullock says she can't rule out another rate rise

image.altText: Shenanee wearing a short with orange, green and purple gradient, standing on a pier by the water.

props.synopsis: In 2017, Shenane Hogg woke from a nine-month induced coma following an attack from her then-partner. The incident had been the last in a series of physical assaults, but she says the first red flag in the relationship was much more subtle.

title.children: Shenane woke from a coma to find she was $56,000 in debt. This is how she fought her way back

image.altText: Illuminated logos of Coles and Woolworths outside of each supermarket in a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: A Greens-led Senate inquiry on supermarket pricing calls for hefty fines for grocers who mistreat suppliers, but recommendations to forcibly break-up retailers and make price gouging illegal fail to attract broad support.

title.children: Supermarkets inquiry calls for hefty fines for grocers who mistreat suppliers

image.altText: An orange sunset in a cloudy sky over the rocky shoreline of Saibai

props.synopsis: Five men are in custody on Saibai Island in the Torres Strait after being caught crossing into Australia illegally.

title.children: Five men in custody after being caught crossing illegally into Australia

image.altText: Two men wearing military uniforms hold a man in civilian clothes. All faces are burred.

props.synopsis: Ukraine's primary internal security agency says it has detained two men over an alleged Russian plot to assassinate president Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

title.children: Ukraine arrests two security officials over alleged Russian plot to assassinate Zelenskyy

image.altText: Vladimir Putin holds his hand on a red book in front of a screen showing the Russian flag colours of red, white and blue

props.synopsis: Australia was among a number of other Western countries that did not attend Vladimir Putin's presidential inauguration due to Russia's war in Ukraine.

title.children: Russia's Vladimir Putin sworn in for fifth presidential term as Australia boycotts ceremony

image.altText: A book with the title Same-Sex parents featuring two men and a young boy

props.synopsis: A slim majority of Cumberland City councillors voted to remove the book from its libraries in a meeting last week.

title.children: Western Sydney libraries could lose state funding after council votes to ban same-sex parenting book

image.altText: A smiling older couple wearing matching lanyards.

props.synopsis: Alleged attempted murder victim Ross Tighe, who has post-traumatic stress disorder, will have to face questioning at the trial of the man accused of killing his mother, stepfather and brother in Queensland in 2022.

title.children: 'Crucial witness': Court orders sole survivor of triple shooting to face cross-examination

image.altText: Kyllie Cripps and a graphic of closed hands.

props.synopsis: The disproportionate number of First Nations women affected by violence is at the forefront of roundtable talks in Canberra, where the country's gendered violence experts, service directors and survivor-advocates have gathered.

title.children: Calls for 'real action' as First Nations women at centre of roundtable talks on gendered violence

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: Proposed powers to make deporting certain non-citizens easier and impose effective travel bans on countries that do not accept involuntary returns should be made tighter, the Coalition says, warning the laws as drafted would apply to thousands more than intended.

title.children: Coalition calls for 'extraordinary' immigration powers to be tightened as High Court ruling looms

image.altText: Composite image of Tyla, Doja Cat, Lizzo and Chris Hemsworth attending the 2024 Met Gala.

props.synopsis: You’ve seen all the Met Gala looks, now it’s time for the experts’ review on the couture of it all.

title.children: Four Australian fashion icons help us unpack the Met Gala

image.altText: A close up of Zendaya wearing a black corset with a headpiece that looks like a bouquet of roses

props.synopsis: The dress code was inspired by a short story about a count and countess who use their enchanted garden to buy themselves time against an encroaching angry mob.

title.children: Met Gala red carpet: How the stars interpreted the Garden of Time theme

image.altText: HMAS Hobart’s embarked MH-60R helicopter.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has not spoken to China's President Xi Jinping despite diplomatic tensions with Beijing re-emerging after a dangerous Chinese military interception of an Australian Navy helicopter in international waters.

title.children: China lashes out over dangerous helicopter confrontation as Albanese faces pressure to contact Xi Jinping

image.altText: A young white woman with long blonde hair sitting on a couch

props.synopsis: Student groups have described a Commonwealth payment aimed at combating "placement poverty" as "a slap in the face" that's too little, too late, and voiced concerns a means test will restrict access.

title.children: Upcoming 'placement poverty' payment is a 'slap in the face', students groups say

image.altText: Two people stand under black umbrellas, with their pants rolled up as the road floods under heavy rain.

props.synopsis: If you're living in south-eastern Australia, the weather has probably been feeling a bit like Groundhog Day. What's been causing this extended rain streak? And why does it matter for Australia's weather?

title.children: No end in sight: The reason NSW's weather is stuck in a rain streak and why it matters

image.altText: Yarra Valley Grammar School sign

props.synopsis: Yarra Valley Grammar has expelled two students after the discovery of a document that used offensive terms to rank female pupils.

title.children: Two boys expelled from Melbourne private school over offensive spreadsheet ranking female students

image.altText: A photo of a child in school uniform attached to a fridge.

props.synopsis: A transgender prisoner policy was issued in 2009. It was meant to ensure the safety of transgender and other prisoners. But, over the next eight years, Marjorie Harwood was repeatedly placed with males and experienced significant trauma.

title.children: Marjorie's family thought her placement in male prison was a mistake. A phone call confirmed it was more than that

image.altText: Nala Mansell holding bag at office desk.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Aboriginal Centre says it is "horrified" after the coroner's office dropped off human remains in brown paper bags without warning to its reception on Friday.

title.children: Human remains, potentially over a thousand years old, dropped off to Aboriginal group in paper bags

image.altText: NT Police announce a $250,000 reward for information over the disapperance of Paddy Moriarty.

props.synopsis: A South Australian buyer who phoned in to the auction was the winning bidder, and is understood to want to use Paddy Moriarty's former home as an NT base for winter escapes.

title.children: Missing man Paddy Moriarty's Larrimah home sells at auction for $32k

image.altText: A schoolboy wearing a black backpack with his face digitally blurred.

props.synopsis: Police have seized items from the family home of a 16-year-old schoolboy who was fatally shot by officers as they probe the motivation behind his weekend knife attack.

title.children: 'No cell or conspiracy': Police seize Perth teen's mobile phones as stabbing attack motivation probed

image.altText: The pool at Double Island resort is lined with green sludge.

props.synopsis: The Queensland Land Court rules in favour of stripping Hong Kong based billionaire Benny Wu of the Double Island resort lease but leaves the final decision in the hands of Resources Minister Scott Stewart.

title.children: Barrister criticises developer's 'derelict resort'

image.altText: A man on a stage with flags behind him points towards the middle distance

props.synopsis: Next week's budget will see an increase in welfare payments, Treasurer Jim Chalmers reveals, while warning the government needs to be careful about what it can afford.

title.children: Treasurer flags welfare measures in next week's budget

image.altText: Tim Pallas delivering a speech during question time.

props.synopsis: The Victorian budget has confirmed delays to the Airport Rail Link, as the state government outlines its plan to tackle the state's rising record debt.

title.children: Victorian ratepayers asked to help with budget repair as debt soars to record highs

image.altText: A sketch of Erin Patterson wearing a blue jumper and thin framed black glasses with her hair tied back.

props.synopsis: Accused killer Erin Patterson formally pleads not guilty to murder over the alleged mushroom poisonings of three of her relatives, and elects to have her case "fast-tracked" to a Victorian Supreme Court trial.

title.children: Erin Patterson, accused of murdering three with mushroom meal, enters not guilty plea

image.altText: Police officers lead a man into the back of a police car

props.synopsis: Two men, including a former childcare worker, will likely spend decades behind bars after being sentenced for hundreds of child abuse offences.

title.children: Two men jailed for total of 63 years for 'some of the most evil crimes imaginable'

image.altText: A woman holding up a picture

props.synopsis: Sharon Fowke says her husband was treated like a second-class citizen during his stay at a regional Queensland hospital. Advocates say the case is not surprising.

title.children: Anthony Fowke's 'horrific' stay at hospital ended with his death in a storeroom

image.altText: Four bakers hold different parts of a really long baguette entering a rotating oven.

props.synopsis: French bakers have cooked the world's longest baguette at 140.53 metres, reclaiming a record that was held by Italy for the past five years.

title.children: France reclaims world record for making the longest-ever baguette

image.altText: A boy plays on an iPad

props.synopsis: In this week's round-up of tech news, a closer inspection reveals the tricky aspects of implementing age verification for porn, OpenAI is due to launch its own search tool and Reddit sleuths seek out the origins of the most mysterious song on the internet.

title.children: The difficulty of age verification for porn, Open AI's search threat, and the most mysterious song on the internet

image.altText: A man in barefeet holds up a power cord running over red dirt

props.synopsis: Residents in Embalgan, north of Broome, are using long power cords from a costly diesel generator to supply their electricity, as the state government rolls out upgrades in remote communities.

title.children: Remote residents resorting to network of extension cords to keep the lights on, but help is on the way

image.altText: A woman of Indian descent stands looking solemn on a university campus.

props.synopsis: International student Varnika Singh was filmed by one of her assailants during the attack at the University of Wollongong. Those responsible have been sentenced, but an advocate says such incidents are on the rise.

title.children: 'Helpless in the moment': Uni student told to kiss attacker's shoe during knifepoint robbery

image.altText: Bonza planes on tarmac

props.synopsis: More details emerge over the full extent of the budget airline's collapse with nearly 60,000 customers and 120 suppliers owed money.

title.children: Federal court hears Bonza creditors' meeting 'would need a stadium' with 60,000 affected customers

image.altText: cattle graze on a green paddock

props.synopsis: After years of continuous drought, record rain has transformed the Nullarbor region. For pastoralists, it means livestock can finally return to their properties.

title.children: Big rains like 'oxygen itself' as Nullarbor farmers look to greener pastures and restocking
